meanings.meaning_en_US: A statement that represents something as better or worse than it really is.

examples.sentence: His story was full of [exaggeration] for dramatic effect.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的故事充滿了誇張以增強戲劇效果。

examples.sentence: To make a point, she relied on [exaggeration].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了強調觀點，她依賴於誇張。

examples.sentence: In advertising, [exaggeration] is a common technique.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在廣告中，誇張是一種常見的技巧。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To have a strong emotional effect on someone.

examples.sentence: She felt [overwhelmed] by the amount of work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 面對大量工作，她感到不知所措。

examples.sentence: The beauty of the landscape can [overwhelm] visitors.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這種風景的美麗可以讓遊客目不暇接。

examples.sentence: He was [overwhelmed] with gratitude after the support he received.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在獲得支持之後，他感到無比感激。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To catch up with and pass while traveling in the same direction.

examples.sentence: He tried to [overtake] the slower vehicle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他試圖超過那輛慢車。

examples.sentence: During the race, she managed to [overtake] her opponents.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在比賽中，她成功超越了對手。

examples.sentence: The motorcycle zoomed past as it [overtook] the car.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 摩托車呼嘯而過，超過了那輛車。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To entice someone to do something, often something that is unwise or wrong.

examples.sentence: The dessert was too delicious to [tempt] her.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 甜點太美味了，讓她難以抗拒。

examples.sentence: He struggled to resist the [temptation] to skip work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他努力抵抗跳過工作的誘惑。

examples.sentence: They tried to [tempt] him into playing the game.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們試圖引誘他參加比賽。

meanings.meaning_en_US: Feeling or showing envy; resentful longing.

examples.sentence: She felt [envious] of her friend's success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她對朋友的成功感到嫉妒。

examples.sentence: His [envious] gaze made her uncomfortable.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他嫉妒的目光讓她感到不安。

examples.sentence: Being [envious] only brings negativity.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 嫉妒只會帶來負面情緒。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A feeling of great surprise or wonder.

examples.sentence: She looked at him in [astonishment].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她驚愕地看著他。

examples.sentence: To his [astonishment], he won the lottery.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 令他驚訝的是，他中了彩票。

examples.sentence: The crowd gasped in [astonishment] at the magician's trick.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人群對魔術師的把戲驚愕地倒吸一口氣。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To give (someone) the right to do or have something.

examples.sentence: Her promotion will [entitle] her to a higher salary.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的晉升將使她有資格獲得更高的薪水

examples.sentence: This card will [entitle] you to special discounts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這張卡將使您有資格獲得特別折扣

examples.sentence: The new policy [entitles] all employees to more vacation days.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新政策使所有員工有權享有更多的假期

meanings.meaning_en_US: To evoke or awaken a feeling, emotion, or response.

examples.sentence: The movie was able to [arouse] deep emotions in the audience.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這部電影能夠在觀眾中喚起深刻的情感。

examples.sentence: The speech will [arouse] interest in science among young students.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這篇演講將激起年輕學生對科學的興趣。

examples.sentence: Her smile seemed to [arouse] curiosity in everyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她的微笑似乎在每個人心中激起了好奇心。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To shake or move with a slight trembling motion.

examples.sentence: The leaves began to [quiver] in the breeze.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 葉子在微風中開始顫抖。

examples.sentence: She could see his lip [quiver] as he tried not to cry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她看到他的嘴唇在努力不哭時顫抖。

examples.sentence: A sudden chill made her body [quiver].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 一陣寒意讓她的身體顫抖。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A person who makes or enacts laws.

examples.sentence: The [lawmaker] proposed a new bill.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這位立法者提議了一項新法案。

examples.sentence: Every [lawmaker] has a duty to represent their constituents.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每位立法者都有責任代表其選民。

examples.sentence: The conference invites every [lawmaker] to discuss important issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 會議邀請每位立法者討論重要議題。

meanings.meaning_en_US: An injury appearing as a purple or blue mark on the skin.

examples.sentence: I got a [bruise] on my arm from bumping into the table.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在手臂上有一個瘀傷，是因為撞到了桌子

examples.sentence: The child showed her mother the painful [bruise].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 孩子向她的母親展示了那個痛的瘀傷

examples.sentence: Apply ice to the [bruise] to reduce swelling.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在瘀傷上敷冰塊以減少腫脹

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make someone aware of or familiar with.

examples.sentence: Let me [acquaint] you with the team.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 讓我讓你熟悉一下團隊。

examples.sentence: I want to [acquaint] him with the new system.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我想讓他熟悉這個新系統。

examples.sentence: She was [acquainted] with many people in the industry.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她與這個行業中的許多人都很熟悉。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make (someone) feel very sad or unhappy.

examples.sentence: The news about the disaster can [depress] anyone.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有關災難的消息能使任何人都感到沮喪

examples.sentence: He tends to [depress] those around him with his negative attitude.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的負面態度往往會使身邊的人感到沮喪

examples.sentence: It's hard not to feel [depressed] during tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艱難時期很難不感到沮喪

meanings.meaning_en_US: A moving staircase that carries people between floors of a building.

examples.sentence: Take the [escalator] to the first floor.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 搭乘電扶梯到一樓。

examples.sentence: The [escalator] is out of service.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 電扶梯故障。

examples.sentence: She stood on the moving [escalator].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她站在這部移動的電扶梯上。

meanings.meaning_en_US: A short journey undertaken in order to deliver or collect something.

examples.sentence: He went on an [errand] to pick up groceries.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他去跑腿去買雜貨。

examples.sentence: She asked him to run an [errand] for her.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她請他幫忙做一件差事。

examples.sentence: My [errand] took longer than expected.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我的差事花了比預期更長的時間。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make something impure by exposure to or addition of a poisonous or polluting substance.

examples.sentence: The spill could [contaminate] the water supply.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這次洩漏可能會污染水源

examples.sentence: They tested to see if the food was [contaminated].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們測試食物是否被污染

examples.sentence: Chemicals can [contaminate] soil.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 化學物質可以污染土壤

meanings.meaning_en_US: A tendency to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen.

examples.sentence: His [pessimism] often affects his decision-making.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的悲觀主義常常影響他的決策。

examples.sentence: We cannot allow [pessimism] to hinder our progress.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們不能讓悲觀主義妨礙我們的進步。

examples.sentence: She tries to combat her [pessimism] with positive thoughts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她試著用積極的想法來抵抗她的悲觀主義。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To become dry and shriveled.

examples.sentence: The flowers will [wither] without water.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這些花如果沒有水會枯萎。

examples.sentence: As winter approaches, many plants [wither].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 隨著冬天的到來，許多植物會枯萎。

examples.sentence: Failing to get enough sunlight will cause leaves to [wither].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 缺乏足夠的陽光會使葉子枯萎。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To burst forth violently, often used in relation to volcanoes.

examples.sentence: The volcano may [erupt] at any moment.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這座火山可能隨時會爆發。

examples.sentence: Tears [erupted] from her eyes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 淚水從她的眼中湧出。

examples.sentence: The argument [erupted] into a heated fight.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這場爭吵演變成了激烈的打鬥。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To cry out or speak suddenly with strong emotion.

examples.sentence: She [exclaimed] in surprise when she saw the gift.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當她看到禮物時驚呼。

examples.sentence: He [exclaimed] that he won the lottery.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他驚呼自己中了彩票。

examples.sentence: They [exclaimed] with joy at the news.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們對這消息高興地驚呼。
